item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, March 28, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. I drove 300 miles, then asked police to send me surveillance footage of my car. (193 points | 107 comments)
2. Getting hit by lightning is good for some tropical trees (9 points | discuss)
3. Preschoolers can reason better than we think, study suggests (73 points | 36 comments)
4. Architecture Patterns with Python (261 points | 56 comments)
5. The Biology of B-Movie Monsters (2003) (8 points | 5 comments)
6. Cross-Platform P2P Wi-Fi: How the EU Killed AWDL (15 points | 1 comment)
7. MilliForth-6502: The smallest Forth real programming language for 6502 (28 points | 1 comment)
8. Giant, fungus-like organism may be a completely unknown branch of life (197 points | 79 comments)
9. Retreating Glaciers Expose 1,500 Miles of Coastline (23 points | 9 comments)
10. PermitFlow (YC W22) Is Hiring Senior/Staff Engineers in NYC ( | hide)
11. Things I would have told myself before building an autorouter (269 points | 55 comments)
12. How to Use Em Dashes (–), En Dashes (–), and Hyphens (-) (468 points | 349 comments)
13. Tracing the thoughts of a large language model (844 points | 294 comments)
14. A note on the USB-to-PS/2 mouse adapter that came with Microsoft mouse devices (272 points | 75 comments)
15. How to Write Blog Posts That Developers Read · Refactoring English (19 points | 6 comments)
16. Let's Take a Look at JEP 483: Ahead-of-Time Class Loading and Linking (18 points | 8 comments)
17. Entropy Attacks (36 points | 6 comments)
18. Are Levi's from Amazon Different from Levi's from Levi's? (39 points | 18 comments)
19. I tried making artificial sunlight at home (444 points | 204 comments)
20. 7.7 magnitude earthquake hits Southeast Asia, affecting Myanmar and Thailand (129 points | 45 comments)
21. How I Choose What to Work On (2023) (65 points | 18 comments)
22. Every Flop Counts: Scaling a 300B LLM Without Premium GPUs (90 points | 3 comments)
23. Golang on the Playstation 2 (166 points | 7 comments)
24. Estimating Camera Motion from a Single Motion-Blurred Image (50 points | 15 comments)
25. I genuinely don't understand why some people are still bullish about LLMs (539 points | 931 comments)
26. Mid-pregnancy pollution exposure linked to postpartum depression (35 points | 6 comments)
27. Abundance isn't going to happen unless politicians are scared of the status quo (275 points | 409 comments)
28. Learning Theory from First Principles [pdf] (174 points | 22 comments)
29. Open Source Mythology (24 points | 12 comments)
30. Plasmonic Modulators Break Wireless Terahertz Barrier (18 points | 6 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, March 28, 2025 at 2:15 PM UTC
